channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Field-Mediated Semantic Organization in Large Language Models: Evidence for Quantum-Like Properties in Artificial Neural Systems
item.description: Specifically, we demonstrate that Phi-2 exhibits strongly quantum-like transitions between personality states (adaptability score: 1. 00), while Phi-4-mini-instruct shows balanced quantum properties across all dimensions (LQPI score: 0. 54), Llama-3. 2-1B-Instruct displays superior topological protection of semantic content (coherence score: 0. 50) and gemma-3-1b-it shows predominantly classical computational properties (LQPI score: 0. 16).

item.title: Structure Is Not Enough: Leveraging Behavior for Neural Network Weight Reconstruction
item.description: This allows such models to be applied to a wide variety of downstream tasks, and they demonstrate strong predictive performance and low reconstruction error.

item.title: Dereflection Any Image with Diffusion Priors and Diversified Data
item.description: Reflection removal of a single image remains a highly challenging task due to the complex entanglement between target scenes and unwanted reflections.

item.title: FFaceNeRF: Few-shot Face Editing in Neural Radiance Fields
item.description: To utilize masks with a desired layout, an extensive training dataset is required, which is challenging to gather.

item.title: FastCuRL: Curriculum Reinforcement Learning with Progressive Context Extension for Efficient Training R1-like Reasoning Models
item.description: In this paper, we propose \textbf{\textsc{FastCuRL}}, a simple yet efficient \textbf{Cu}rriculum \textbf{R}einforcement \textbf{L}earning approach with context window extending strategy to accelerate the reinforcement learning training efficiency for R1-like reasoning models while enhancing their performance in tackling complex reasoning tasks with long chain-of-thought rationales, particularly with a 1. 5B parameter language model.

item.title: CVE-Bench: A Benchmark for AI Agents' Ability to Exploit Real-World Web Application Vulnerabilities
item.description: Large language model (LLM) agents are increasingly capable of autonomously conducting cyberattacks, posing significant threats to existing applications.

item.title: AIMI: Leveraging Future Knowledge and Personalization in Sparse Event Forecasting for Treatment Adherence
item.description: However, effective forecasting systems for treatment adherence based on wearable sensors are still not widely available.

item.title: PromptHash: Affinity-Prompted Collaborative Cross-Modal Learning for Adaptive Hashing Retrieval
item.description: Cross-modal hashing is a promising approach for efficient data retrieval and storage optimization.

item.title: NeuralFoil: An Airfoil Aerodynamics Analysis Tool Using Physics-Informed Machine Learning
item.description: This work discusses the methodology and performance of NeuralFoil with several case studies, including a practical airfoil design optimization study including both aerodynamic and non-aerodynamic constraints.

item.title: Unleashing Vecset Diffusion Model for Fast Shape Generation
item.description: To address these challenges, we present FlashVDM, a systematic framework for accelerating both VAE and DiT in VDM.

item.title: Design and Implementation of an FPGA-Based Tiled Matrix Multiplication Accelerator for Transformer Self-Attention on the Xilinx KV260 SoM
item.description: Recognizing that the Q, K, and V linear projections within the Multi-Head Self-Attention (MHA) module represent a critical computational bottleneck, we strategically focused our efforts on accelerating these operations.

item.title: Sonata: Self-Supervised Learning of Reliable Point Representations
item.description: In this paper, we question whether we have a reliable self-supervised point cloud model that can be used for diverse 3D tasks via simple linear probing, even with limited data and minimal computation.

item.title: Parameters vs. Context: Fine-Grained Control of Knowledge Reliance in Language Models
item.description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) mitigates hallucinations in Large Language Models (LLMs) by integrating external knowledge.

item.title: Blend the Separated: Mixture of Synergistic Experts for Data-Scarcity Drug-Target Interaction Prediction
item.description: Extensive experiments on 3 real-world datasets under different extents of input data scarcity and/or label scarcity demonstrate our model outperforms states of the art significantly and steadily, with a maximum improvement of 53. 53%.

item.title: Automating 3D Dataset Generation with Neural Radiance Fields
item.description: By utilizing the universal 3D representation and rendering capabilities of Radiance Fields, our pipeline generates high quality 3D models for arbitrary objects.

item.title: M3: 3D-Spatial MultiModal Memory
item.description: We present 3D Spatial MultiModal Memory (M3), a multimodal memory system designed to retain information about medium-sized static scenes through video sources for visual perception.

item.title: Unreal-MAP: Unreal-Engine-Based General Platform for Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: In this paper, we propose Unreal Multi-Agent Playground (Unreal-MAP), an MARL general platform based on the Unreal-Engine (UE).

item.title: Control Pneumatic Soft Bending Actuator with Online Learning Pneumatic Physical Reservoir Computing
item.description: The proposed PRC-based online learning control framework provides a novel approach for harnessing physical systems' inherent nonlinearities to enhance the control of soft actuators.

item.title: Exploring the Reliability of Self-explanation and its Relationship with Classification in Language Model-driven Financial Analysis
item.description: Language models (LMs) have exhibited exceptional versatility in reasoning and in-depth financial analysis through their proprietary information processing capabilities.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning-based Heuristics to Guide Domain-Independent Dynamic Programming
item.description: We propose using reinforcement learning to obtain a heuristic function to guide the search in DIDP.

item.title: Tokenize Image as a Set
item.description: This paper proposes a fundamentally new paradigm for image generation through set-based tokenization and distribution modeling.

item.title: Deconstructing Long Chain-of-Thought: A Structured Reasoning Optimization Framework for Long CoT Distillation
item.description: Recent advancements in large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable reasoning capabilities through long chain-of-thought (CoT) reasoning.

item.title: NuiScene: Exploring Efficient Generation of Unbounded Outdoor Scenes
item.description: In this paper, we explore the task of generating expansive outdoor scenes, ranging from castles to high-rises.

item.title: Zero-1-to-A: Zero-Shot One Image to Animatable Head Avatars Using Video Diffusion
item.description: To address this issue, we propose Zero-1-to-A, a robust method that synthesizes a spatial and temporal consistency dataset for 4D avatar reconstruction using the video diffusion model.

item.title: Iterative Optimal Attention and Local Model for Single Image Rain Streak Removal
item.description: To address these limitations, we propose an Expectation Maximization Reconstruction Transformer (EMResformer) for single image rain streak removal.

item.title: XAttention: Block Sparse Attention with Antidiagonal Scoring
item.description: In this paper, we introduce XAttention, a plug-and-play framework that dramatically accelerates long-context inference in Transformers models using sparse attention.

item.title: Denoising-based Contractive Imitation Learning
item.description: We provide theoretical analysis showing that the denoising network acts as a local contraction mapping, reducing the error propagation of the state transition and improving stability.

item.title: SALT: Singular Value Adaptation with Low-Rank Transformation
item.description: The complex nature of medical image segmentation calls for models that are specifically designed to capture detailed, domain-specific features.

item.title: Tuning LLMs by RAG Principles: Towards LLM-native Memory
item.description: Memory, additional information beyond the training of large language models (LLMs), is crucial to various real-world applications, such as personal assistant.

item.title: Detecting LLM-Written Peer Reviews
item.description: We find a high success rate in the embedding of our watermarks in LLM-generated reviews across models.

item.title: UniCrossAdapter: Multimodal Adaptation of CLIP for Radiology Report Generation
item.description: Automated radiology report generation aims to expedite the tedious and error-prone reporting process for radiologists.

item.title: Probabilistic Prompt Distribution Learning for Animal Pose Estimation
item.description: To this end, we propose a novel probabilistic prompting approach to fully explore textual descriptions, which could alleviate the diversity issues caused by long-tail property and increase the adaptability of prompts on unseen category instance.

item.title: Don't Fight Hallucinations, Use Them: Estimating Image Realism using NLI over Atomic Facts
item.description: Our approach is based on the premise that LVLMs may generate hallucinations when confronted with images that defy common sense.

item.title: Semantic-Guided Global-Local Collaborative Networks for Lightweight Image Super-Resolution
item.description: Single-Image Super-Resolution (SISR) plays a pivotal role in enhancing the accuracy and reliability of measurement systems, which are integral to various vision-based instrumentation and measurement applications.

item.title: Towards Lighter and Robust Evaluation for Retrieval Augmented Generation
item.description: Therefore, we propose a study which demonstrates the interest of open-weight models for evaluating RAG hallucination.

item.title: Agentic Keyframe Search for Video Question Answering
item.description: Video question answering (VideoQA) enables machines to extract and comprehend key information from videos through natural language interaction, which is a critical step towards achieving intelligence.

item.title: UMIT: Unifying Medical Imaging Tasks via Vision-Language Models
item.description: In addition, it is applicable to multiple imaging modalities (e. g., X-ray, CT and PET), covering a wide range of applications from basic diagnostics to complex lesion analysis.

item.title: OSLoPrompt: Bridging Low-Supervision Challenges and Open-Set Domain Generalization in CLIP
item.description: We introduce Low-Shot Open-Set Domain Generalization (LSOSDG), a novel paradigm unifying low-shot learning with open-set domain generalization (ODG).

item.title: Bokehlicious: Photorealistic Bokeh Rendering with Controllable Apertures
item.description: Bokeh rendering methods play a key role in creating the visually appealing, softly blurred backgrounds seen in professional photography.

item.title: CausalCLIPSeg: Unlocking CLIP's Potential in Referring Medical Image Segmentation with Causal Intervention
item.description: Inspired by large-scale pre-trained vision-language models, we propose CausalCLIPSeg, an end-to-end framework for referring medical image segmentation that leverages CLIP.

item.title: MapGlue: Multimodal Remote Sensing Image Matching
item.description: This paper proposes MapGlue, a universal MRSI matching framework, and MapData, a large-scale multimodal dataset addressing these gaps.

item.title: Binarized Mamba-Transformer for Lightweight Quad Bayer HybridEVS Demosaicing
item.description: Quad Bayer demosaicing is the central challenge for enabling the widespread application of Hybrid Event-based Vision Sensors (HybridEVS).

item.title: MathFusion: Enhancing Mathematic Problem-solving of LLM through Instruction Fusion
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have shown impressive progress in mathematical reasoning.

item.title: SA-Occ: Satellite-Assisted 3D Occupancy Prediction in Real World
item.description: Existing vision-based 3D occupancy prediction methods are inherently limited in accuracy due to their exclusive reliance on street-view imagery, neglecting the potential benefits of incorporating satellite views.

item.title: Rapid patient-specific neural networks for intraoperative X-ray to volume registration
item.description: The integration of artificial intelligence in image-guided interventions holds transformative potential, promising to extract 3D geometric and quantitative information from conventional 2D imaging modalities during complex procedures.

item.title: Single Image Iterative Subject-driven Generation and Editing
item.description: Personalizing image generation and editing is particularly challenging when we only have a few images of the subject, or even a single image.

item.title: VerbDiff: Text-Only Diffusion Models with Enhanced Interaction Awareness
item.description: Recent large-scale text-to-image diffusion models generate photorealistic images but often struggle to accurately depict interactions between humans and objects due to their limited ability to differentiate various interaction words.

item.title: Generalized Few-shot 3D Point Cloud Segmentation with Vision-Language Model
item.description: In this work, we introduce a GFS-PCS framework that synergizes dense but noisy pseudo-labels from 3D VLMs with precise yet sparse few-shot samples to maximize the strengths of both, named GFS-VL.

item.title: The Emperor's New Clothes in Benchmarking? A Rigorous Examination of Mitigation Strategies for LLM Benchmark Data Contamination
item.description: In this paper, we design a systematic and controlled pipeline along with two novel metrics-fidelity and contamination resistance-to provide a fine-grained and comprehensive assessment of existing BDC mitigation strategies.

item.title: Uni-3DAR: Unified 3D Generation and Understanding via Autoregression on Compressed Spatial Tokens
item.description: The first is a two-level subtree compression strategy, which reduces the octree token sequence by up to 8x.
